nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 15 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | club-update = 6 May 2018 | ntupdate = 17 September 2015 }} '''Pedro Chirivella Burgos''' ({{IPA-es|ˈpeðɾo tʃiɾiˈβeʎa}}; born 23 May 1997) is a Spanish professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Extremadura UD]], on loan from English club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]]. ==Club career== ===Liverpool=== Born in [[Valencia]], Spain, Chirivella developed his trade at the academy of local club [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] where he captained the club at various youth levels.{{cite web|url=https://liverpoolfcacademynews.wordpress.com/2013/06/21/who-is-pedro-chirivella/|website=The Liverpool FC Academy Football Blog|title=Who is Pedro Chirivella?|date=21 June 2013|accessdate=4 January 2017}} During his time with Valencia, Chirivella was scouted by a number of European clubs but it was [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] who signed him in 2013 along with fellow Spaniard [[Sergi Canós]] from [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisanfield.com/2015/08/sergi-canos-liverpools-former-barcelona-academy-forward-profile/|title=Sergi Canos: Liverpool’s former Barcelona academy forward in profile|website=This is Anfield|last=Lusby|first=Jack|date=16 August 2016|accessdate=17 September 2015}} In order to aid Chirivella's transition to England, Liverpool moved his family north from Spain and provided them with work and accommodation.{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisanfield.com/2015/08/pedro-chirivella-lowdown-liverpools-spanish-academy-star/|title=Pedro Chirivella: The lowdown on Liverpool’s Spanish academy star|website=This is Anfield|date=14 August 2015|accessdate=4 January 2017|last=Lusby|first=Jack}} He joined up with Liverpool's academy and on 7 July 2014 was one of seven youngsters to be handed a professional contract by the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/165933-seven-young-reds-sign-pro-contracts|title=Seven young Reds sign pro contracts|website=Liverpool F.C.|date=7 September 2014|accessdate=17 September 2015}} ====2015–16 season==== Chirivella received his first taste of senior football when he was included in club [[Manager (association football)|manager]] [[Brendan Rodgers]]' squad for Liverpool's pre-season tour of Asia and Australia.{{cite web|url=http://readliverpoolfc.com/2015/07/13/youngsters-on-pre-season-tour/|title=Youngsters on Pre-season Tour|website=Read Liverpool|last=Killen|first=Stephen|date=13 July 2015|accessdate=4 January 2017}} During the tour he made his non-competitive debut for Liverpool, coming on as a second-half [[substitute (association football)|substitute]] against [[Helsingin Jalkapalloklubi|HJK Helsinki]]. He received his first competitive call up later in the season for Liverpool's [[UEFA Europa League]] [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League group stage|group stage]] match against [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]] on 17 September 2015. In the 28th-minute, following an injury to centre-back [[Kolo Touré]], Chirivella was brought on to make his debut and played out the remainder of a 1–1 draw at the [[Nouveau Stade de Bordeaux]].{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/sep/17/liverpool-bordeaux-europa-league-match-report|title=Liverpool denied by Bordeaux’s Ferreira Jussiê in Europa League draw|date=14 September 2015|website=Guardian|last=Nakrani|first=Sachin|accessdate=18 September 2015}}{{cite web|title=Bordeaux 1–1 Liverpool|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34203664|website=BBC Sport|last=Chowdhury|first=Saj|accessdate=17 September 2015}} His next appearance for the club saw him make his [[FA Cup]] debut under new manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] on 8 January 2016 when he came on as a substitute in a third round match against [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]].{{cite web|url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35155398|title=Exeter City – Liverpool|date=8 January 2016|website=BBC Sport|last=Rose|first=Gary|accessdate=8 January 2016}} Liverpool ultimately progressed in the Cup which afforded Chirivella the opportunity to make his first start for the club on 9 February 2016 in a 2–1 defeat against [[West Ham United]] in the fourth round replay.{{cite web|url =https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35467976|title=West Ham United – Liverpool|date=9 February 2016|website=BBC Sport|last=Jurejko|first=Jonathan|accessdate=9 February 2016}} Chirivella then signed a new contract with Liverpool on 9 March before making his Premier League debut towards the back end of the season, starting in a 3–1 loss against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 1 May.{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/210788-pedro-chirivella-signs-new-liverpool-contract|website=Liverpool Football Club|title=Pedro Chirivella signs new Liverpool contract|last=Shaw|first=Chris|date=9 March 2016|accessdate=4 January 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3567974/Liverpool-s-Pedro-Chirivella-latest-teenage-starlet-make-Premier-League-debut-he.html|title=Liverpool's Pedro Chirivella is the latest teenage starlet to make his Premier League debut ... But who is he?|website=Daily Mail|last=Bassam|first=Tom|date=1 May 2016|accessdate=4 January 2017}} ====2016–17 season: Loan to Go Ahead Eagles==== On 6 January 2017, Liverpool announced that Chirivella, who had spent the first half of the season playing for the club's U23 side, would spend the remainder of the season on loan at [[Eredivisie]] club, [[Go Ahead Eagles]] in order to gain more first team experience.{{cite web|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/249257-pedro-chirivella-joins-go-ahead-eagles-on-loan|title=Pedro Chirivella joins Go Ahead Eagles on loan |website=Liverpool Football Club|last=Lynch|first=David|date=6 January 2017|accessdate=6 January 2017}} He made his debut for the club on 13 January 2017, playing the full match in a 3–1 defeat to [[AZ Alkmaar]].{{cite web|url=https://www.eredivisie.nl/nieuwsbericht/chirivella-en-manu-in-basis-go-ahead-tegen-az|website=Eredivisie|language=nl|title=Chirivella en Manu in basis Go Ahead tegen AZ|date=12 January 2017|accessdate=19 January 2017}} The following week, Chirivella scored his first professional goal, heading in the opener from [[Jarchinio Antonia]]'s cross in a 1–1 draw with [[SBV Excelsior|Excelsior]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thisisanfield.com/2017/01/kent-chirivella-score-ward-fulton-keep-clean-sheets-liverpool-fc-loan-watch/|website=This is Anfield|title=Kent & Chirivella score, Ward & Fulton keep clean sheets – Liverpool FC Loan Watch|last=Twelves|first=Ben|date=23 January 2017|accessdate=23 January 2017}} He ultimately made 17 appearances for the campaign and scored twice but could not help prevent the club avoid relegation at the end of the season.{{cite web|url=http://www.footballinsider247.com/ill-never-forget-support-liverpool-farewell-twitter/|title=I'll Never Forget the Support - Liverpool Midfielder Sends Farewell to Fans on Twitter|website=Football Insider|last=Byrne|first=Harvey|date=15 May 2017|accessdate=15 May 2017}} ====2017–18 season: Loan to Willem II==== On 26 July 2017, Chirivella returned to Netherlands after being loaned to [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]] for the season.{{cite news|title=Chirivella joins Willem II on season-long loan|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/269689-chirivella-joins-willem-ii-on-season-long-loan|work=Liverpool FC}} He made his debut for the club on 13 August, starting in a 2–1 defeat to Excelsior.{{cite web|url=http://www.friendsofliverpool.com/2017/08/loan-report-awoniyi-makes-big-impression-debut/|title=The Loan Report: Awoniyi makes big impression on debut|website=Friends of Liverpool|last=Whitlock|first=Dominic|date=14 August 2017|accessdate=31 August 2017}} ====2018-19 season: Loan to Extremadura==== On 31 January 2019, he signed for Spanish club [[Extremadura UD]] on loan.{{cite news|title=Pedro Chirivella joins Extremadura UD on loan|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/336281-pedro-chirivella-liverpool-extremadura-loan|work=Liverpool FC}} On 13 February, however, the club announced he could not play for the first team during the remainder of [[2018–19 Segunda División|the season]], as his transfer documentations arrived after the time limit.{{cite web|url=https://as.com/futbol/2019/02/13/segunda/1550070535_092285.html|title=Chirivella no podrá jugar en el Extremadura|trans-title=Chirivella will not be able to play at Extremadura|publisher=[[Diario AS]]|language=es|date=13 February 2019|accessdate=15 February 2019}} ==International career== Chirivella represented Spain at [[Spain national under-17 football team|under-17]] level and scored twice for them in 15 appearances. ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 6 May 2018}} {{soccerway|pedro-chirivella/274936|accessdate=4 January 2017}} {|
